cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Greater Antilles, forecast to emerge into the Gulf of Mexico and arc northwest toward the northwest Gulf coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Louisiana–Texas border (south-west Louisiana/upper Texas coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Current watches confined to Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, Hispaniola, southeastern Bahamas and Turks & Caicos.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings confined to Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands, parts of Dominican Republic/Haiti and the southeastern Bahamas.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cone covers the entire northern Gulf coast from Texas to the Florida Panhandle by day-5.
weather_observation.wind: Low (7%) chance of 34-kt winds within 5 days; probabilities expected to rise if the track trends westward.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for >3 ft surge in Sabine/Calcasieu estuaries if future forecasts bring a hurricane close to the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands possible late Tue–Wed with amounts potentially exceeding 4 inches if the center tracks near the TX-LA border.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado risk in outer rain bands and possible port‐access channel shoaling from surge/river flooding.
